alert.note: Alert for Burke; Caldwell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 2:17PM EST until December 27 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following counties, Burke and Caldwell. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 215 PM EST, Locally excessive runoff will continue across the Johns River basin through the rest of the afternoon. Remain wary of lingering flooding of low-lying areas such as Adako, Coffey, Playmore Beach and Johns River Roads. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Morganton, Collettsville, Edgemont, Globe and Upton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
